Kefir and Breast Cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer kefir site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True

In conclusion, kefir is effective in inhibiting proliferation and inducing apoptosis of HTLV-1-negative malignant T-lymphocytes. Therefore, further in vivo investigation is highly recommended.Citation: Journal:None, Date:None

Of the foods/nutrients studied, dairy protein had the strongest association with height growth. These findings suggest that a factor in the non-lipid phase of milk, but not protein itself, has growth-promoting action in girls.Citation: Journal:None, Date:None

There is a growing body of literature on the use of natural products for cancer prevention. To date, few trials have demonstrated conclusive benefit. Current guidelines recommend against the use of natural products for cancer prevention.Citation: Journal:None, Date:None
